basics.name: Arastun Mammadli
basics.label: MSc Applied Computational Science and Engineering Student
basics.summary: MSc Applied Computational Science and Engineering student at Imperial College London, specializing in applied AI, machine learning, and deep learning. Passionate about applying these methods to real-world challenges in scientific computing and computational science.

courses: Extended Essay on Computer Science (Genetic Algorithms)

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Developed machine learning models for real-time lightning storm prediction.
highlights: Developed DL (U-Net, Conv-LSTM) models for storm prediction
Processed and analyzed satellite imagery and time-series data
Built predictive models for VIL frame forecasting and lightning flash prediction

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Developed an airburst impact simulation model with optimized parameters.
highlights: Implemented a nonlinear solver using the bisection method
Designed a bounding box algorithm for efficient postcode and population impact analysis
Automated testing and CI/CD integration for reliability

work.name: EMBAWOOD LLC
work.summary: Developed and maintained Java-based applications using the Spring Framework.

interests.name: Research in AI, ML, and Scientific Computing
